intro: Gnidia occidentalis, commonly known as the Western gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Gnidia occidentalis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
